Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2013 03:07PM Janice54 wrote: I have been NED now for 6 years.  I was dx with bone mets from the get go and six months later I was dancing with NED.  I only have taken tamoxifen. I have had no chemo, no radiation, no surgery and no side effects.  My dr. calls me a freak and I love it.  When I was first dx, like everyone else I was devistated and started planning my funeral.  Good thing I didn't put any money down.  I did take control by changing my diet and that empowered me.  Today I am healthier and more thankful for each new day. I have seen my four children married and now have two grandsons.  I have taken many vacations and accomplished so much in six years.  I am blessed.
Posts.Title: Roll Call 2013 LilSchatzie reader123

Posts.Content: Janice54 wrote: It is true.  It happened, happening to me.  I was dx Oct.  2006,  at age 51, breast cancer with bone mets. I cried the first day and the second I hit the books.  I immediately changed my diet and out look.  Nov. I started tamoxifen.  Dr. said no chemo, no radiation, no surgery.  Horse is out of the barn.  Let us see how the tamoxifen works.  He didn't place much faith in my diet change.  Not much scientific proof.  I figure it couldn't hurt.  So I did both. Six months later I was NED and I am still dancing with him.  I keep up with my diet and the tamoxifen. Dx 10/6/2006, IDC, 4cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/liver, Grade 1, mets, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Radical remission on Dr. Oz Janice54 exbrnxgrl

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2014 06:33PM Janice54 wrote: First I had my annual mamo.  I got them every six months because I had the worst fiber cystic breast dr. ever saw.  They saw nothing but my breast started dimpling.  So I had a ct scan and mri.  That picked up the 4cm mass.  Then I had a steriotactic biopsy.  That pointed to stage 2.  During all this I broke my shoulder water skiing and that got the drs. attention.  Biopsied the shoulder about the same time and dx with stage 4.

Posts.Title: Radical remission on Dr. Oz Janice54 exbrnxgrl

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2014 07:19PM Janice54 wrote: well my drs. call my cancer bazaar.  My onc, who I see every three months, laughs and calls me a freak (in a good way).  I have 4 hospitals, studing my cancer because they can't understand it.  They don't recognize diet as a governing factor.  So hearing about this sheds some light on my story.  I downloaded the book yesterday and so far it coukd have been written about me.
Posts.Title: Radical remission on Dr. Oz Janice54 exbrnxgrl

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2013 02:41PM Janice54 wrote: I was dx 6 1/2 years ago with bone mets from the start.  The day I was DX, no the next day, I changed my diet and ate vegan like.  I bought tons of books and figured what do I have to lose (I lost those stubborn pounds and regained energy). Never had chemo or surgery or rads.  Just took tamoxifen with no side effects.  Six months later I was NED and six years later,I still am.  Do I believe my diet helped, yes, but for me.  Is it a cure all no, I would never stop taking my tamoxifen.  What it did do for me is empowered me to feel like I had some control.  That was the best part of it all.  If there is a one percent chance that it would help and not be harmful (because we all should eat more healthy) then that is my insentive.
Posts.Title: Do any of you restrict certain foods? brandall SchnauzerMom

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2007 10:19AM Janice54 wrote: My husband has been great but my brother has written me off.  That hurts almost as much as having cancer.  Since I was dx a year ago two of my daughters have gotten married which he didn't even acknowledge and then his daughter just got married (my godchild) and I wasn't even invited.  I talked to him the after the first marriage to share my feelings and he was all understanding and then he goes and does it again.  He is also a Deacon in a Catholic church and I find out he has been using my story in his sermons.  How the power of prayer cured me??? I am ned but not cured.  My father was dx with stage 4 also 6mths ago and I need my family, all of us, together.  Instead I dealing with drama and crap.

Posts.Title: bone mets survivors riverinerabbit mom2acat

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2012 11:12AM Janice54 wrote: I was dx 6 1/2 years ago  with bone mets.  My OC said I would not see retirement.  My new OC says I will be around for the next twenty years.  I have been NED for six years and have only taken tamoxifen.
Posts.Title: Expected Life SPAMgirl jocanuck1951

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 02:30PM - edited Jan 30, 2008 02:31PM by Janice54 When I was dx last oct with bone mets I ran to the bookstore and did research.  I changed my diet to no more white stuff...sugar white flour, potatoes, ect.. no unhealthy fats and I try to buy organic.  Six months later I was scanned and I am NED.  The Drs. where amazed.  If there is a one percent chance that this could help I am taking it.  I know it can't hurt.  I lost those stubborn pounds I couldn't shed and have more energy.  Do I miss candy and sweets.... you bet but I would miss life with my husband and kids more.  The only treatment I have had is tamoxifen with no side effects.
Posts.Title: Low carb diet for metastatic BC? Analemma Irina

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2008 02:36PM - edited Jul 26, 2008 02:37PM by Janice54 Gina,   Yes I do it whole wheat.  My husband doesn't even notice the difference in his spaghetti.  I just had another pet/ct scan done two weeks ago and my Drs. are still amazed.  :) NED (my best dance partner) means no evidence of disease.
Posts.Title: Low carb diet for metastatic BC? Analemma Irina

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2008 07:19AM Janice54 wrote: I hope no one here completely trust the opinions of others.  That is all these are.  One study says one thing and another says something else.  You have to do some research yourself to find the answers.  Not just from one source either.  I do what I feel is right for me after tons of research and it has worked.  It may not for others.  There are so may different types of BC and  add that to your genic make up and it is anybodies guess as to how the cancer will react.  I feel though it is important for you to take some sort of control and learn as much as you can about this beast.  Then give it the fight of your life.
Posts.Title: Low carb diet for metastatic BC? Analemma Irina

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2011 09:02PM - edited Sep 11, 2011 09:02PM by Janice54 I was dx first time out with bone mets in Aug. 2006.  Six months later I was NED and still am.  Never had chemo or rads.....just tamoxifen with no side effects.  I am a lucky girl :)
Posts.Title: How long since your stage 4 diagnosis? Iwillwinthisbattle harvey

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2018 01:22AM - edited Dec 29, 2018 11:50AM by Janice54 I am going on 13 years. I was dx and told I had three years. WRONG ANSWER. Six month after my dx and only taking tamoxifen,I was NED. I remained so until 4 1/2 years ago. It came back in my liver. Went on femara and three months later it was gone. I Got a few hot spots on my spine and switched to flasodex 6 months ago. So far no side effects, No chemo, No rads, No surgery. So we never now how our body will deal with this beast. So I have learned not to go off the deep end. I just take a deep breath and believe it will be fine. As Scarlett says, "I will think about it tomorrow," if things change I deal with it as a chronic problem not a terminal one. Life is good! Bless you all!!❤
Posts.Title: Any stage IV surviving 5+ years ? dorimak Yvette1952

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2012 10:09AM Janice54 wrote: I have been dancing with NED for five years!  I was dx five and a half years ago with bone mets.  Never had chemo or rads.  Just tamoxifen and wam, bam, bye, bye cancer!  Everyone reacts differently to this beast so don't go by stats.
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed pjwoodin pq2

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2008 08:39AM Janice54 wrote: My husband and I gave my four adult children beautiful silver stars with the center engraved "Together Forever".  My husband gave a touching speech of how proud we are of them and our wish is that they will always be there for each other.  They are to hang this star year round to remind them of our love and that we are always looking out for them no matter where we are.  Then my husband, to my surprise, gave one more star to me.  With this he said I am the glue that holds us together.  In the center of the star is engraved the word "Family".

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2007 12:05PM Janice54 wrote: Hi Kenna,  Sorry to hear your news.  I was also dx a year ago in Oct. for the first time with bc with bone mets.  I was put on tamoxifen and as of July my pet scan showed no evidence of the cancer (NED).  The day I found out I had cancer I took control back and read, read, read about what I had and what to do.  I then changed my diet and that gave me something positive to think about.  My best to you and I hope you to will find some peace in all this.
Posts.Title: Metastatic at presentation Kelolo Annie4

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2008 10:35AM Janice54 wrote: My story started in May of 06.  I noticed dimpling and had it checked out.  Dr. said it was because of fibercystic breasts.  We'll watch for three months.  In July the family went on vacation to a lake.  First night out my husband steps on a copperhead snake.  Here we go to the emergency room.  His leg swelled up, so he had to keep it up.  He is a trooper though and didn't let it stop him from being on the water.  I love water skiing and my husband couldn't drive the boat because of his foot.  We tried to teach my father-in-law to pull me out of the water.......not good......he caused me to break my shoulder trying to get out of the water.  Went again to the emergency room.  They didn't like the way my bone looked ...sent me to an onc back home....they didn't know what the heck it was.  Actually said they had never seen it before.  Even sent my records to Bethesda Hospital in Md.  I went back to my breast dr. and told her I have bc with bone mets.  She laughed and said "NO way."  I demanded a MRI and guess what they found?? Test done on shoulder after that and yet again.....BC.  Went for second opinions at Duke.  Started on tamoxifen and six months later I was NED and still am.  Just goes to show you the drs don't know everything.  You have to go with your gut and stand up for yourself.  I hated snakes before but today I thank God for them! Janice
Posts.Title: Gathering Encouraging Stories omlivewbc Janice54
